description: Increasing length runs of consecutive composite numbers (starting points).
comments: There are runs of n consecutive composite numbers for every n. For example, the n numbers (n+1)!+2 ... (n+1)!+2+n-1 are composite. Such a run may occur earlier (then starting with (n+1)!+2).  The first term of the first run of (at least) n consecutive composites is a(n). [_Joerg Arndt_, May 01 2013]
links: Jens Kruse Andersen, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..74 (using A002386)

mathematica: maxGap = 1; Reap[Do[p = Prime[n]; gap = Prime[n+1] - p; If[gap > maxGap, Print[p+1]; Sow[p+1]; maxGap = gap], {n, 2, 10^8 }]][[2, 1]] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Jun 15 2012 *)
